intro: Bartschella, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plants are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in the southwestern United States and Mexico. Bartschella species are usually perennial herbs with hairy stems and opposite leaves. They thrive in well-drained soils and are often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
